questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks is implementing Enterprise Territory Management for its retail sales. The Sales Director wants to organize Territories based on their characteristics.
How can the Consultant meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
creating a Territory Management Model with Territory Hierarchy and with priority is the most effective way to organize territories based on their characteristics for Cloud Kicks' implementation of Enterprise Territory Management. This approach will enable Cloud Kicks to make informed decisions about territory management, optimize sales efforts, and achieve its business goals.
Why is A not correct?

choices.B: Create a Territory Management Model with Territory Hierarchy and with priority.
choices.D: Create a Territory Model with Territory Hierarchy and set allocations.
choices.A: Create a Territory Hierarchy, and set allocations and assignments.
choices.C: Create a Territory Types with priority and then create a Territory based on Territory Types.
Create a report with newly created Opportunities and have sales management subscribe to the report.
choices.D: Turn on the Chatter feed settings that enable stage notifications to opportunity owners.
choices.B: Turn on the Chatter feed settings that enable users to automatically follow records that they create.
choices.A: Use Process Builder with an Action Type of Follow Chatter when a record is created or edited.

questions.question_text:
In order to increase and promote adoption, sales management at Cloud Kicks wants sales representatives to follow Opportunities they create.
Which two actions should the Consultant recommend to create a solution? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
D would only notify stage changes, C would report to managers, not opp owners

I’m confused! The “right answers” on this question show B and C. Now, the question asks about notifying the Reps, not the management. Why wouldn’t you want to notify the Reps??? I’ve seen several questions here where the supposedly “correct” answers simply don’t make sense.

Selected Answer: BD
B. Turn on the Chatter feed settings that enable users to automatically follow records that they create.

This setting will automatically follow any opportunity that a sales representative creates, ensuring that they receive updates and notifications about the opportunity in their Chatter feed. This will make it easier for sales representatives to stay informed about the status of their opportunities and take action when necessary.

D. Turn on the Chatter feed settings that enable stage notifications to opportunity owners.

This setting will send notifications to the opportunity owner whenever the opportunity progresses to a new stage. This will keep sales representatives informed about the progress of their opportunities and help them to identify potential problems or opportunities for closing.

Selected Answer: BD
B, D is correct

questions.question_text:
Cloud Kicks has enabled territory forecasts to see how expected revenue compares between sales territories, and to know which territory has the most closed deals in a month. The territory hierarchy has three branches with child territories, with forecast managers assigned to a few of them.
Which two actions can forecast managers perform? (Choose two.)

choices.B: They can add territories to the hierarchy.
choices.D: They can share their forecast with any Salesforce user.
choices.C: They can see all of their territory forecasts in a single-page summary view.
choices.E: They can share their summary view with any Salesforce user.
choices.A: They can share their forecast with any external user.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C,D is correct.

C and D
Forecast managers can't share their summary view.

Selected Answer: CE
"D" is not correct. They wouldn't share thier forecast. "C" & "E".

Forecast managers can share their forecasts with any Salesforce user at their company. When sharing, they specify whether a coworker can make adjustments or only view the shared forecasts. Forecast managers can’t share their summary view.
Forecast users can see all their territory forecasts in the single-page summary view

Selected Answer: CE
Sharing individual territory forecasts is less efficient than sharing a consolidated summary view, as it requires sharing multiple reports or dashboards. The summary view provides a holistic overview of all territories, making it a more effective tool for collaboration and analysis.

questions.question_text:
The Sales Director at Cloud Kicks noticed that while Lead conversion rates were high, Opportunities were not moving through the sales cycle. Many of the contacts that were converted had no phone, email, or background information captured.
Which three solutions can be used to improve the quality of Leads being converted? (Choose three.)

choices.E: Update web-to-lead forms to require input fields be completed prior to submission.
choices.D: Implement a trigger that warns the user of incomplete information during Lead conversion.
choices.B: Review Lead conversion mapping to ensure necessary fields are mapped correctly.
choices.A: Mandate that all Lead data must be reviewed prior to being created in Salesforce.
choices.C: Create a validation rule to check that necessary information is complete upon Lead conversion.
choices.F: Schedule a report that notifies Lead owners daily of Leads with incomplete information.
